item.title: Linear Algebra using NumPy
item.description: For beginner NumPy users with a linear algebra backgorund, it’s easy to understand that to define a matrix, $A=\begin{bmatrix}1&2\\3&4\end{bmatrix}$, we should use A = np.array([[1,2],[3,4]]) since A Out[2]: array([[1, 2], [3, 4]]) A.shape Out[3]: (2, 2) However, how should $x=\begin{bmatrix}1\\2\end{bmatrix}$ be defined? Should we use a 1-D array x1 = np.array([1,2]) x1 Out[4]: array([1, 2]) x1.shape Out[5]: (2,) or a 2-D array with 1 column x2=np.array([[1],[2]]) x2 Out[6]: array([[1], [2]]) x2.
